intro: Delissea hirtella var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved delissea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth, glabrous surface, distinguishing it from other varieties of Delissea. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of pink or purple, and are borne on terminal spikes. This species thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments.
